intro: Leptilon pusillum, commonly known as the small leptilon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Leptilon pusillum is often found in association with other early successional plants in disturbed habitats.
